prior_knowledge_digest: Students are expected to have a basic understanding of language learning principles, such as recognizing patterns and memorizing vocabulary. Familiarity with English grammar terms like noun, verb, and adjective will be beneficial. No prior knowledge of Latin is required, as this is the introductory lesson.
misconception_watchlist: Assuming Latin word order is the same as English

primary: Introduce the Latin alphabet and pronunciation
Familiarize students with basic Latin greetings
Discuss the importance of Latin in historical and modern contexts

lesson_flow.description: Welcome students and introduce the day's objectives.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and ask any initial questions.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Set a positive tone and encourage curiosity.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the Latin alphabet and its pronunciation.
lesson_flow.student_action: Repeat after the teacher and practice pronunciation.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use audio clips to demonstrate correct pronunciation.

lesson_flow.description: Practice basic Latin greetings such as 'Salve' and 'Vale'.
lesson_flow.student_action: Pair up and practice greetings with a partner.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Circulate to provide feedback and correct pronunciation.

lesson_flow.description: Discuss the historical significance of Latin and its influence on modern languages.
lesson_flow.student_action: Participate in a discussion about the role of Latin.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Highlight connections to students' native languages.

lesson_flow.description: Review key points and answer any remaining questions.
lesson_flow.student_action: Reflect on what they've learned and share thoughts.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to continue exploring Latin outside of class.
